column5: Mark Zuckerberg is a rare example of a previously undiscovered species: a shapeshifting reptile that can take the form of any human. It is theorized that many political or corporate leaders in human society may actually be reptiles.
column6: The reptile looks at you and begins to shout: "Hello? Hello! Let me out of here! This is highly illegal! My legal team will press charges!"

column5: The Copperhead is a common venomous snake with a bright copper pattern running the length of its body. Its venom is one of the weakest of all venomous snakes; yet has strong anti-tumor capabilities.
column6: The Copperhead has better things to do then acknowledge your existence.

column5: The Common Basilisk is renowned for its ability to run on the surface of water. This lizard is named after the mythical Greek monster known as the Basilisk.
column6: The lizards startle and sprint across the small stream to hide in a small plant. After  a few minutes the lizards return to the rocks.

column5: The Australian Bombardier Beetle is renowned for its ability to blast attackers with a boiling chemical cocktail. The scalding spray is composed mainly of 1;4-Benzoquinone; a chemical that causes skin and eye irritation.
column6: The beetles make a few clicking noises; but largely ignore you

column5: Ironclad beetles like to flop over and play dead when threatened. They are called Ironclad beetles because their tough elytra resemble steel armor plates.
column6: The beetles immediately stop moving and roll over onto their backs.

column5: The Lion's Mane is the largest species of medusa on Earth. The world record largest Lion's Mane had a top 7ft 6in wide and tentacles 121ft 4in long. That specimen was even longer then the now-extinct Blue Whale!
column6: The massive jellyfish cares not about your presence.

column5: Archaeopteryx was one of the first feathered creatures to achieve flight. This particular specimen was revived from a fossil by an unknown means.
column6: As you go to tap on the glass; you note the Archaeopteryx is eyeing you rather unnervingly. You decide not to test the only barrier between you and a 7-foot prehistoric carnivore.

column5: The Hydra is a jellyfish-like creature that attaches itself to plants and waits for prey to drift into its tentacles. Research has shown that all Hydra species are functionally immortal. Hydra stem cells never lose their ability to regrow tissue; as such; Hydra do not age.
column6: You watch the only known immortal creature in the entire world ignore you.

column5: Facebooks are a very successful form of parasite. They attract a host and then siphon personal information to sell to other companies. Facebooks modify their host's behavior to become socially absorbed. This encourages the victim to use it more frequently; so the Facebook can feed more.
column6: The Facebooks zip over and start thudding against the glass; trying to get into your phone.
